body: Closes: #98

title: Remove dependency on `sp-std` and `sp-core`

title: Rust: Bump `prost` to version 0.11
body: Closes: #92

title: adds support for host functions to ics23
body: This encapsulates all crypto hash functions behind a trait, so downstream crates can delegate these functions to host functions

title: Remove Cargo.lock
body: As requested in https://github.com/confio/ics23/pull/84

title: Bump prost to 0.10 in /rust
body: The dependencies to `prost` and `prost-build` are updated to the latest version.

title: Handle empty with custom order
body: Make sure left/right_branches_are_empty code properly accounts for custom ordering (when branches are not in lexographical order).

title: Update TypeScript to 4.5 and target to es2017
body:
es2017 should easily be supported by all potential users. We will now migrate from es2017 to es2018 in CosmJS but we can take it easy here.

The TS upgrade does not seem to cause any trouble, nice.

title: Add missing comma
body: Fixes a collision between #72 and #57

title: Migrate from tslint to eslint
body: tslint is not maintained anymore. This uses more or less the eslint setup of CosmJS.

title: Remove unused encoding code; move helpers to test code only
Update prettier to 2.5.1 and format code
Update shx
body: This is an alternative fix to #64 which is a bit more straight forward and updates not only shelljs

title: Bump minimum supported Rust version to 1.51.0
body:
Required by https://github.com/tokio-rs/prost/pull/552

This should fix the CI.

title: Use @noble/hashes
body:
This gives us lighter hash implementations.

See https://medium.com/nomic-labs-blog/a-safer-smaller-and-faster-ethereum-cryptography-stack-5eeb47f62d79 for the background of this implementation.

title: Check for placeholder nodes in proof verification
body:
Certain proofs (like those for a SMT) can contain empty nodes which are equal to the `EmptyChild`, but currently these will cause verification to fail for non-existence proofs if they appear where a real sibling node would be invalid, i.e. on a path that must be the leftmost or rightmost path of a subtree.

This adds a check to detect and ignore such nodes during verification of left- and rightmost paths. This will be needed in order to support SMT proofs in https://github.com/confio/ics23/pull/57.

title: vector commitments spec broken
body: ibc repo was reorganised which broke the readme link

title: Add `SmtSpec` for SMT proofs
body: This will be needed for implementing [ADR-040](https://github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/blob/master/docs/architecture/adr-040-storage-and-smt-state-commitments.md) in Cosmos-SDK; specifically this PR depends on it: https://github.com/cosmos/cosmos-sdk/pull/10015

title: Refactoring go test cases to be in json format
body:
To make test cases more reusable by the different implementation present
in this repo, this commit moves test cases in the go reference
implementation to json format in testdata.

title: Use explicit conversion to `anyhow::Error` to fix compilation in `no_std` mode
body:
Supersedes: #48

Context: https://github.com/confio/ics23/pull/48#issuecomment-954960745

> Since the ?-based error conversions would normally rely on the std::error::Error trait which is only available through std, no_std mode will require an explicit .map_err(Error::msg) when working with a non-Anyhow error type inside a function that returns Anyhow’s error type.
> https://docs.rs/anyhow/1.0.44/anyhow/#no-std-support

Re: https://github.com/confio/ics23/pull/48#issuecomment-955201946

I am unfortunately not able to add a proper no-std test harness at the moment, as the crate needs a bunch more work to be fully no-std compatible, eg. by removing or replacing `anyhow` (potentially with `flex-error`) since it's is not fully `no-std` compatible despite what their docs say. We have such a test harness in `ibc-rs` and we will try to port it over eventually and finish up the `no-std` work together with @DaviRain-Su who is the actual customer for this feature. We at Informal are only trying to enable Substrate to use the `ibc` crate in a no-std environment.

Reproducing the compilation error itself is not trivial either as it has only appeared for us when trying to `cargo publish` the `ibc` crate. It's unclear why this does not trigger when building without the `std` feature.

For now, we do not need full `no-std` support in ics23, just fixing this compilation error would already unblock the next release of Hermes :)

title: Bump `prost` to version 0.9
body:
Closes: #52

I made sure to regenerate the Rust proto definitions with `cargo protoc` and `cargo fmt` but they didn't change at all.

This changes have been tested in `ibc-rs` via this corresponding PR: https://github.com/informalsystems/ibc-rs/pull/1501
